Reviews.Title: “Live to Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Lovelifemd
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and basichotel for the price. Hotel staffs with English communication was barely adequate. Hotel service was average. Breakfast was fair, you may get tired with the same food if you stayed there for more than couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in the heart of the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: A very convenient location for a very modern hotel. One block from Termini central station, two blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore Church and two stops from the Colosseum. The rooms are very spacious, clean all equipped with an LCD television and mini fridge. The bathroom is modern as well and big. The continental buffet breakfast is very generous and the staff proved to be helpful and friendly. I'd recommend this hotel to families and solo travellers for its gods value for money

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: crissitoe
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently stayed here, based on positive reviews on booking.com. However, we were both extremely disappointed.... so disappointed that for the last couple nights of our stay, we cancelled our room at California and instead stayed at the much better Hotel Sweet Home (which is in the same building, on the 2nd floor). For the price that they charge, it was definitely not worth it. 1. BROKEN ELEVATOR. Our room was on the 4th floor, which is really 5 flights of stairs up. Usually, we wouldn't mind the exercise but after walking around Rome the whole day, the last thing we wanted to do was climb 5 flights of stairs to our room. 2. NO PHONE DIRECTORY IN ROOM. We couldn't even call the front desk from our room. 3. NO TV REMOTE IN ROOM. We had to walk down 5 flights of stairs and specifically request a remote control. 4. WIRELESS INCONSISTENT. Internet access worked for us only the first night but not the subsequent nights, which was very frustrating. 5. EVER USED A TABLE CLOTH AS A BATH TOWEL? Well, that was the texture of the bath towels that were provided. 6. THIN WALLS. Could hear the neighbors talking on the phone till 1am. Positives: 1. Rooms very clean. 2. Good location. My advice to everyone: If you want to stay close to Roma Termini, you DON'T have to stay HERE. There are plenty other hotels in the area, and even in the same building (e.g. Hotel Sweet Home)

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jodieamber1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a long weekend visit to Rome, my 2nd time. Although we were slightly put off by the huge scaffolding outside which we never knew about, once we were inside everything was fab. Staff were lovely, rooms were cleaned daily and of a good size. The breakfast was amazing and plenty to choose from and we could keep our cases in the lobby after checkout! The only downturn is that the TV had 0 english channels and the wi-fi kept disconnecting. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Older Rooms Available. Easy Access to Main Termini Train Station”
Reviews.Author: bagjob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here about 6 times. The hotel is located a block from the main train and bus station, Termini. Because of this it's the easiest location in Rome to find, and get in an out of. Some people might think the area is a little seedy but it's well-patrolled, has been cleaned up considerably, and I have never had any problems. The hotel is in the process of a major rehab. I was given one of the older rooms but they changed it to a sleek contemporary one for me. The hotel is safe and clean, and once you arrive at Termini on the Leonardo Express train from the airport, you can be in your room in a few minutes. The room comes with continental breakfast and free internet in the lobby. For a safe, clean, convenient, and affordable place to stay, the Hotel California definetly fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “horrible elevator and b/fast”
Reviews.Author: johnson m
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel during 1st week of Nov. Good staff. But century old elevator and below one star rated break fast and the ambiance is worth only for one star, though they say it is rated 3*. Location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Del_Cuore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a stone's throw from Roma Termini - perfect location. Reasonably good restaurants around. Close to the main Roman tourist attractions and shopping areas. Fantastic staff - very helpful who spoke Spanish and English in addition to Italian and even let us leave our bags at the lobby for a couple of hours after check-out! Comfortable, clean room WITH AC...WIFI available. You must stay here at least once!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kasia G
Reviews.Content: TO AVOID!! We maid our reservation via booking.com 2 months in advance. When we arrived they informed us that they cancelled our reservation because of problem with our credit card (without informing us, they had our tel & email). The credit card worked for the reservation in 8 other hotels in Italy during our trip. They offered us someone else reservation (who was also supposed to arrive the same day) but with double price. We refused. The owner and reception staff were really rude und unfriendly. They said we wouldn't find anything in the whole city. But we find a room in nice Divina Hotel across the street 2 minutes later (when they heard our story they offered us the same price as the one we had in our reservation via booking at California). If you wish to have a place to stay in Rome stay away from hotel California.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not much else”
Reviews.Author: mistry11
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's location and it was indeed nice to be so close to the Termini for access to trains, busses, hop-on hop-off buses and lots of restaurants. The hotel was clean but in a very old building where the single elevator was slow and tempermental. The breakfast is simple but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Susie-Lous
Reviews.Content: The Reception area is deceiving. Once you pass through the door to go to the run down hallway, elevator, etc., you are lead to a room with no remote for the T.V., no hot water to bathe, thin walls so you hear the people right next door, doors broken to the closet, and safe wires ripped out from the safe...so there was no safe. You get one towel each, and they are very thin. Bring your own toiletries. We didn't dare try the breakfast. We ran to check out as quickly as possible in the a.m. after a night of hell with the noise in the next roorm.

Reviews.Title: “It's a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueberry090
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay in Rome for two nights as we were on a transit flight. We’ve been to Rome before and thought we would take our chance by finding a hotel when we got to termini. The last min reservation counter helped us find this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel has an old fashioned elevator – which is kind of cool – but of course tiny. The rooms are really clean and quite spacious but very basic with a tv, fridge and safe! The staff were really friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to termini, some main attractions and restaurants. We also rented a scooter for the day which is 5 min walk from the hotel on Via Cavour. The only downside is that at night you can hear the noise from the street as the hotel is next to a restaurant and road. Also, don’t expect much of a breakfast – it consisted of coffee, juice, yogurt and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Things to avoid in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Jules24London
Reviews.Content: Not impressed as we walked in to a fairly nice reception and were taken to some terrible building "behind the nice reception" with a disgusting lift to an bedroom that did not impress us at all.. Breakfast is to run away from.. Stay well clear from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but ok”
Reviews.Author: hubro
Reviews.Content: Two nights in January with no need to test the air-condition. Room a bit run down but clean and plenty of space. Not the best english-speakers at the reception, but really no big problem. Breakfast ok. To be in a rough and noisy area, not the worst choise.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: AletaSerbia
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are planning your holiday in Rome from Serbia, don't ever do it through Kontiki travel agency: they will put you in the hotel you didn't choose, which you are told at the airport (when there is nothing you can do about it :-(. I agree with the most horrible comments I read on this Trip advisor about California Hotel: the only good thing is the hotel locatin, but within the same area there are many more possible better hotels, so you do not have to choose this particualr one (if you have a choice, of course, which we didn't have). The room was dark with old dark blue wallpapers, old furniture, but the worse were: central aircondition which you cannot control (so it was either cold or extremely hot) and the most stupid shower I ever seen (fixed on the top of so-called "shower-cabin" with an awful plastic curtains, so that showering was a kind of a nightmare specially if you are a women).. The breakfast was poor and he breakfast room, which was in the basement, was very cold, so where ever you go from the reception desk to your "room" or to breakfast, you must put your coat on! One more thing: I read the official website of the hotel California and I HAVE TO SAY THAT NOTHING IS TRUE THERE, ESPECIALLY THE PHOTOS!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just don't go there...”
Reviews.Author: candy4u
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and the walk from station dodgy (esp for females). The night watchman does not speak any English and was of no help. He also took our passports off us, which I was very uncomfortable with. The rooms were VERY down at heel, with the lamps being broken, the shower broken and the blanket was simply gross. The bed was hard as nails. Also (quite amusingly at times) the walls are thin as paper. We could hear the guy next door taking a dump, oh and people throwing up in the stairwell - lovely. We paid Eu140 a night and have since found out there are lots of (much) better value for money hotels elsewhere. I am a regular traveller and this is the worst hotel I've stayed at for YEARS. My boyfriend and I went to Rome for a romantic weekend, Rome didn't let us down, but the hotel sure did. Don't go there.....

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it if you can”
Reviews.Author: Kitten70
Reviews.Content: Good location for train station. But rooms were really old and the service at breakfast (which stops at 9.30!) was a little bit rude. Also, our door had been forced to be opened (before we arrived), it is not a safe place in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal58
Reviews.Content: Hotel California is located near Termini Station, but far enough to be away from some of the "traffic" - about 5 - 10 minutes walk. Their website was helpful BUT I found making the booking a little confusing - I ended up calling to confirm the rate & dates of stay as I could not believe how informal they were when I contacted them by e-mail. Antonio, desk clerk/manager, was very helpful and when we checked in, greeted me like an old friend. The lift was something out of the norm for me, but once you accept that old style European accomodations are different than what we are accustomed to in the USA, it is no problem - just part of the adventure! The hotel shares the building with another hotel, so certain floors were theirs and others were not. The room was clean and comfortable with large shuttered windows which could be opened to view the street below. The furnishings were a little worn but everything was spotless. I will never forget our first night, standing in the open window, listening to the sounds of a violin playing Italian love songs for the diners in the sidewalk cafes. Directly across the street was a little mom & pop cafe where we enjoyed dinner with a personal touch. The location worked well for us as we had arrived by train from the airport and were leaving from Termini to take the overnight train to Paris. Additionally, the tour company we used to for our Rome at night tour and our tour to Pompeii was located only 1 block away. We stayed 3 nights for about the same price as it would have cost to spend 1 night in some of the other hotels. The breakfast buffet was good and served in a pleasant environment. I felt safe enough to walk the streets around the hotel unaccompanied, even at night - but as always, use common sense when out alone - Rome, like all big cities, has it's share of pickpockets and street kids. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this hotel. Additionally, it is located on the right side of Termini, was very convenient to public transportation and could even be considered within walking distance to some of the popular sites, such as the Coloseum, Republic Square, Santa Susanna. On our last day in Rome, we were able to leave our luggage in the lobby under the watch of the day clerk until that evening when we picked it up and walked back to Termini to continue on our European adventure...

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd read the reveiws....!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DStafford
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in mid-July with air-con that switches off after 2 mins!!!! Need I say more? We thought the lift hilarious - high point of stay! Rooms - down-at-heel - linen clean, fridge cold - but that's it! Breakfast was POOR - very little on offer and what was, very poor quality. Location a bit rough but we had no trouble. That's the perils of online booking!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: jlauren26
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The sheets were very rough, the pillows were flat, the comforter was old, had cigarette burns and did not smell like it had been washed in quite some time. The refrigerator did not get cold. As for the air conditioning, you have no control over it. It barely comes on and at night only (I believe they turn it on for about an hour or so at 11pm, but it does not get cool AT ALL). Extremely poor lighting and located in a terrible neighborhood. THe bathroom was the worst part. The body towels felt like tablecloths and the hand towels were like napkins. And the shower curtain was MOLDY. Really really moldy. It was hard to even get a shower and I didn't feel clean at all when I got out. If you are going to Rome, spend the extra money and stay somewhere else, it will make your trip much more pleasant. Hope this helps you!

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace to master yoda”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From reading the last reviews, I have been inspired to write my own account of the hotel. I being a jedi master did not find the hotels facilities sutible for any living being on any living planet except maybe Jabba the Hutt. But even he would hire a bounty hunter to eliminate the owner when he saw the 150 steps he would have to climb, because according to the ruls of the elevator that I recived when entering the hotel(two bags, one person or three people and one bag at a time in the lift) His weight would exceed the limit and probably bring him to his death. The rooms were unexceptable, even for the amount we payed. There was no room to meditate on the ways of the force and definately no room to spar with lightsabers.( one of the manys things a jedi must day daily, even on a mission) Six padawans to a five bedroom room. One endded up sleeping on the floor, to which if master yoda ever found out, there would be no doubt he would shut the hotel down. We enjured dirty towels every day, which is not very plesent when coming back from a hard fight from a sith lord, and dont even mention the tiolet paper. It was never there. And master Windu gets very annoyed when theres no tiolet paper. This hotel was a disgrace to the eternal city, im just hoping that none of the padawans looked out the window in the middle of the night because they would have seen scenes worse that the lower levels of Corusant.

Reviews.Title: “Mna Sraideanna”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well..... Our hotel journey started 150 steps at the bottom of the staircase next to a wooden box attached to a rope with iron bars around it for 'support'! Because none of us trusted the 'lift' we all used the stairs.... all 34 of us.... 150 stairs.... with our luggage.... ya so upon our arrivals to the rooms we noticed our 'mini bar' was an empty plugged out fridge and our safe.... was soo safe... that it didnt open.... however there was a hole you could pop your money into.... you just couldn't get it out again... The blankets looked like they had been in the hotel since the 30's and covered in moths... which funnily enough, made us all have some sort of allergic reaction and we all got colds while staying there! The bed was broken, the shower was broken, the toilet seat was broken! There were magnificant views... of.. men working hard....*no pun intended*.... and they were happy with audiences of young girls! The restaurant downstairs was lovely, however i would strongly advise you against this neighbourhood if you have: young children, are against mna sraideanna, or any type of passing of materials (illegal or not so) and i would also strongly advise: looking out the windows at night time, and leaving a child watch the television unsuppervised! However, Rome itself is a gorgeous place, its well worth the visit and i wish to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mo19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and found it well worth the money we paid. The staff, although sometimes busy on the phone when attending to you, were very helpful even phoning a tour company for us. The location is excellent being a good setting off point for the main attractions and close to Termini. The rooms were basic but very clean with soap, shampoo, shower caps and a hairdryer provided. Wouldn't rate the air conditioning system and would hate to try it in the height of summer. The pizza/pasta restuarants in the location were good.

Reviews.Title: “whats the problem”
Reviews.Author: jack000
Reviews.Content: Cant see what the problem is with this hotel. location is on the right side of termini most convient if you arrive at termini i.e 5/10minutes walk max. good location for setting out site seeing. rooms o.k. nothing special but clean bit laccking in lighting.breakfast contintental no problem getting extra juice/coffee. liitl restuarant next door handy for afternoon drink the,re quite happy to sell you 1/2 litre carafe of wine if thts all you want,couple of bruchettes with it make a nice tapas newer transport to city worth noting terravision. ciampino to termini direct and you can pre buy a return ticket for best value n.b. make sure you turn up early for the return trip. cant recommend any of the areas retuarants, all typically touristy and too many pizza based. best over the river in travestre but its quite a way

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, staying near the termini might not be a very good idea since it is a very crowded, noisy and congested area. About the hotel, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at anywhere. The staff is not friendly and infact very rude. Even though they say they have air conditioning, the hotel is centrally air conditioned which means no "thermostat" in your room, which means they can turn the AC on and off when they wish too. The hotel owners would turn off the AC at 2 am in the nite, and repeated requests would not be heeded, instead we had the manager tell us "this is not your home". The rooms are clean, but very run down so you will find broken bulbs and wood trim missing on furniture. For the price we paid, 140 euros, you can find a better place to stay in Rome. Even though, we booked the hotel through a website, and the reservations were paid in advance, the hotel owners made us pay again and we have been charged twice on our credit card for the same stay. We are fighting it but it has been a big headache. Please do yourself a favor and do not stay here. The elevator to go up to the 5th floor is very ancient and very small. I had my small kids with me and it was a very frustrating 2 day stay that we had. I will never stay there again ever.

Reviews.Title: “If you must”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are loking for a place close to the termini station, Im sure that there are better options. We stayed for one night and found the staff rude and the room clean but basic. The lobby of the hotel is fairly grand but you have to negotiate an antique lift and several coridoors to find the rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: California Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 39 Via Principe Amedeo, 00185 Rome, Italy
